pullRequest.title: Allow Artifactory UploadDir to be configured via variable file
pullRequest.bodyText:
Give the option to allow Artifactory uploadDir to be configurable
via the defaults.yml or any vendor variable file. Default to the
existing definition. Configure uploadDir based on BUILD_IDENTIFIER.
Also configure Artifactory Repo based on BUILD_IDENTIFIER. Separate
function for set_sdk_versions and add release and sub-release.
[skip ci]
Depends #10457
Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau adam.brousseau88@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText: Instead of seting ARTIFACTORY_CONFIG['uploadDir'] at L773 then updating at L 780, you could simplify by defining a local variable for uploadDir, resolve all placeholders then set ARTIFACTORY_CONFIG['uploadDir']

Shouldn't also define a default value for uploadDir (get_value(VARIABLES.artifactory.uploadDir, default))) in the variable files?
e.g
artifactory:
  uploadDir
    default: ${ARTIFACTORY_CONFIG['repo']}/${JOB_NAME}/${BUILD_ID}/
    nightly: ...
    release: ...
FULL_SDK_VERSION  is global variable and already set in set_sdk_versions(). This is not required.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -618,7 +618,26 @@ def set_build_variables() {
 def set_sdk_variables() {
     DATESTAMP = get_date()
     SDK_FILE_EXT = SPEC.contains('zos') ? '.pax' : '.tar.gz'
-    SDK_FILENAME =  "OpenJ9-JDK${SDK_VERSION}-${SPEC}-${DATESTAMP}${SDK_FILE_EXT}"
+    // Get full version from tag (eg. 11.0.8+10) and replace + with _
+    FULL_SDK_VERSION = sh (

nodes.bodyText: Artifactory settings are defined in the variables file. To be consistent, the uploadDir should also be defined in the varaibles file.

nodes.bodyText: All the other "support" artifacts have a timestamp, likely a good idea to add that to the TEST_FILENAME as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -616,9 +616,21 @@ def set_build_variables() {
 }
 
 def set_sdk_variables() {
+    set_sdk_versions()
     DATESTAMP = get_date()
     SDK_FILE_EXT = SPEC.contains('zos') ? '.pax' : '.tar.gz'
-    SDK_FILENAME =  "OpenJ9-JDK${SDK_VERSION}-${SPEC}-${DATESTAMP}${SDK_FILE_EXT}"
+    SDK_FILENAME = get_value(VARIABLES.misc.sdk_filename_template, BUILD_IDENTIFIER) ?: get_value(VARIABLES.misc.sdk_filename_template, 'default')
+    echo "SDK_FILENAME (before processing):'${SDK_FILENAME}'"
+    // If filename has unresolved variables at this point, use Groovy Template Binding engine to resolve them
+    if (SDK_FILENAME.contains('$')) {
+        set_sdk_impl()
+        // Add all variables that could be used in a template
+        def binding = ["SDK_IMPL":SDK_IMPL, "SPEC":SPEC, "SDK_VERSION":SDK_VERSION, "FULL_SDK_VERSION":FULL_SDK_VERSION, "DATESTAMP":DATESTAMP, "SDK_FILE_EXT":SDK_FILE_EXT]
+        def engine = new groovy.text.SimpleTemplateEngine()
+        SDK_FILENAME = engine.createTemplate(SDK_FILENAME).make(binding)
+    }
+    echo "SDK_FILENAME:'${SDK_FILENAME}'"
+
     TEST_FILENAME = "test-images.tar.gz"

nodes.bodyText:
These calls are not required here. All variables set by these methods are global thus, they are already initialized because variableFile.set_sdk_variables() is called by build_all() at L572 before the archive_sdk().
Also set_sdk_versions() is redundant here, it is called by set_sdk_variables().

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -565,9 +568,9 @@ def build_all() {
                         // Cleanup in case an old build left anything behind
                         cleanWs()
                         add_node_to_description()
-                        // Setup Artifactory now that we are on a node. This determines which server(s) we push to.
-                        variableFile.set_artifactory_config(BUILD_IDENTIFIER)
                         get_source()
+                        variableFile.set_sdk_variables()
+                        archive_sdk()

beforeCommit.message:
[skip ci] debug
